description:
Toyota Technological Institute at Chicago (TTIC or the Institute) is an accredited computer science institute, dedicated to basic research and graduate education in computer science.  Its mission is to achieve international impact through world-class research and education in fundamental computer science and information technology. The Institute is distinctive to the American educational scene in its unique combination of graduate education and endowed research.

TTIC is located in Hyde Park on the University of Chicago campus and has a close affiliation with the University of Chicago Computer Science Department. An agreement between the University of Chicago and TTIC allows cross-listing of computer science course offerings between the two institutions, providing students from each institution the opportunity to register in the other's courses. Faculty and students enjoy full privileges of the University library system, athletic facilities and other services.
name: Toyota Technological Institute at Chicago (TTIC)
tagline: A PHILANTHROPICALLY ENDOWED COMPUTER SCIENCE GRADUATE INSTITUTE.

updates.text: Join us on Friday, Nov. 22 for a virtual PhD Admissions Open House on Friday, November 22, at 10:30 am (CST) via Zoom. Learn more about our #PhDprogram in #computerscience, meet faculty and students, and ask questions during our Q&A: https://buff.ly/3YFsTGb

Congrats to the #NobelPrize2024 winners for AI-driven breakthroughs in protein structure prediction! Learn how TTIC's Prof. Jinbo Xu's pioneering work in #deeplearning helped lay the foundation for these groundbreaking discoveries: https://buff.ly/4dUTzqX

TTIC is proud to co-sponsor the Data, Ethics and Policy Conference 2024! Please join us on October 25 at the Harris School of Public Policy at the University of Chicago. Register and learn more: https://buff.ly/4fbOlbz

The 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded for AI that predicts protein structures. In 2016, TTIC professor Jinbo Xu recognized the potential of using deep learning to attack the protein folding problem in an influential scientific article: https://lnkd.in/gNuKnbNH

TTIC is excited to announce Dr. Ka Yee Lee as the newest member of its Board of Trustees, beginning May 1, 2024. Dr. Lee is the David Lee Shillinglaw Distinguished Service Professor in the Department of Chemistry at the University of Chicago, and has been serving as Interim Dean of the Physical Sciences Division at the University of Chicago since February 2024. Read the full announcement: https://lnkd.in/gAkHTPns

🌟 Exciting Announcement from the CCC! 🌟

In February, the CCC supported three groundbreaking scientific sessions at this year's prestigious AAAS Annual Conference! Throughout the week we’ve been releasing insightful summaries from the first CCC-hosted panel.

🔬 First Panel Highlight: "Generative AI in Science: Promises and Pitfalls" 🔬

Moderated by CCC’s very own Matthew Turk, President of the Toyota Technological Institute at Chicago, this panel brought together brilliant minds to explore the application of generative models in various scientific domains.

💡 Key Speakers and Topics Included: 💡

Dr. Rebecca Willett, Professor of Statistics and Computer Science at the University of Chicago, delved into the indispensable role of generative models in scientific research and emphasized why off-the-shelf models fall short in this context: https://lnkd.in/eJkF_hH3

Dr. Markus Buehler, Professor of Engineering at MIT, illuminated the application of generative models in materials science, offering fascinating insights into this rapidly evolving field: https://lnkd.in/emm-F_X9

Dr. Duncan Watson-Parris, Assistant Professor at Scripps Institution of Oceanography and the Halıcıoğlu Data Science Institute at UC San Diego, shared valuable perspectives on utilizing generative models in climate science research, paving the way for innovative solutions in understanding our planet's climate dynamics: https://lnkd.in/eG37rFrF

Finally, all of the speakers answered questions during the Q&A: https://lnkd.in/en5874tq

Stay tuned for more captivating insights from our upcoming blog series, where we unravel the intriguing discussions from the AAAS Annual Conference! 🚀

 #CCC #GenerativeAI #AAASConference #AIforResearch #ScienceInnovation #ScienceCommunity

TTIC is thrilled to announce a significant philanthropic donation from distinguished computer scientists Lenore Blum and Manuel Blum, which enabled the establishment of TTIC's first two faculty-endowed chairs. Read more: https://lnkd.in/gqP2i6yP

We are hosting a virtual PhD Admissions Open House on Monday, Dec. 4 at 11:00 am CST via Zoom. Learn more about our PhD program in #computerscience from TTIC faculty and students, followed by an open Q&A. Learn more and register (required): https://buff.ly/49U3FYn

The Fall 2023 Junior Theorists Workshop will be held on Thursday, Nov. 30 at Northwestern University and Friday, Dec. 1 at TTIC, and will feature junior researchers in all areas of theoretical #computerscience. Learn more and register: https://buff.ly/3ThYJqz
